intro: Onosma maroccana, commonly known as Moroccan hedge garlic, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Onosma maroccana is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its unique appearance.
